name: 4-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-2-butanone
Reason: 4-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-2-butanone is a compound with several functional groups. The melting point can be estimated by considering the effects of each functional group. The basic unit of comparison is butanone, which has a melting point of -79.6 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the 4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl group will significantly increase the melting point due to the presence of the phenyl ring, the hydroxyl group, and the methoxy group. The phenyl ring will increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the ability to form π-π interactions. The hydroxyl group will increase the melting point due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds. The methoxy group will increase the molecular weight and volume, which will raise the melting point. However, the oxygen atom in the methoxy group also increases the hydrogen bonding potential, which can lower the melting point. Taking these effects into consideration, the net effect should be a significantly increased melting point compared to butanone.
